alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Hancock; Henry; Madison; Marion; Randolph; Rush (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:06AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Madison, Shelby, Hancock, Randolph, Delaware, Rush, northeastern Morgan, northern Johnson, Henry and southern Marion Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 305 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Anderson to Plainfield. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Anderson around 310 AM EDT. Southport around 320 AM EDT. Greenwood around 325 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Franklin and New Castle. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 81 and 112. Interstate 69 between mile markers 226 and 233. Interstate 70 between mile markers 79 and 80, and between mile markers 86 and 133. Interstate 74 between mile markers 93 and 120. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for central and east central Indiana.

area.areaDesc: Delaware; Hancock; Henry; Madison; Marion; Randolph; Rush
